recommendations: Prioritize a dedicated CT Thoracic Aorta protocol for optimal evaluation of the thoracic aorta injury.
Initiate vasopressor support to stabilize hemodynamics (MAP ≥ 65 mmHg) prior to contrast administration.
Implement aggressive IV hydration (e.g., 1L isotonic saline over 30 min pre-contrast, followed by 1L over 2h post-contrast) to mitigate contrast-induced nephropathy risk.
Consider using low-osmolar or iso-osmolar contrast agents with a split-bolus technique to minimize contrast load.
rationale: The primary diagnosis is "Injury to thoracic aorta," necessitating a protocol optimized for aortic visualization over pulmonary embolism.
Severe hypotension (MAP 49.3 mmHg) significantly increases the risk of contrast-induced nephropathy and hemodynamic decompensation.
Aggressive hydration and hemodynamic stabilization are crucial for renal safety and overall patient management in the context of contrast administration.
Weight-based contrast dosing and the use of specific contrast types can further reduce nephrotoxic load.

protocol_selection.name: Trauma CT — Chest, Abdomen & Pelvis with Contrast
protocol_selection.description: Contrast CT of torso with trauma-focused reformats; may include delayed images as needed.
protocol_selection.contrast_timing: Portal venous phase, possible delayed imaging to assess hemorrhage.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Standard contrast dose; trauma protocols may include split bolus techniques.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Minimize field-of-view and dose; use alternative imaging if stable and renal risk high.

protocol_selection.name: CT Pulmonary Angiography (Chest CTA for PE)
protocol_selection.description: CT angiography timed for pulmonary arterial phase (6–13 sec post-contrast) to evaluate pulmonary arteries for embolism.
protocol_selection.contrast_dose: Weight-based; ~100–150 mL iodinated contrast (300 mg I/mL); follow ACR Manual.
protocol_selection.renal_safety_notes: Ensure contrast-to-eGFR ratio <1.1 g/(mL/min); if eGFR <30, consider non-contrast alternatives or weigh risks carefully.
